ICIO Settings

Dimensions of ICIO data for the calculation of globalisation indicators

The Concept

Explore an introduction to the calculation framework underlying the TiVA indicator calculations.

In the following explanation, we focus on the calculations based on gross trade (as opposed to final demand.)

Coefficient data refers to the Leontief inverse for value-added (as opposed to employment or carbon dioxide.)

Impact of trade between two countries on another country

Data types

  • Gross exports, by exporting country and industry to demand country
  • Value-added coefficient matrix, Leontief inverse

Gross Exports Data Structure

  • Rows: 2346 (62 countries + 7 partial * 34 industries)
  • Columns: 69 (62 countries + 7 partial)

Coefficient Data Structure

  • Rows: 2346 (62 countries + 7 partial * 34 industries)
  • Columns: 2108 (62 countries * 34 industries)

Data dimensions

  • Export country
  • Export industry
  • Demand country

Result dimensions:

  • Value-added source country
  • Value-added source industry
